questions.question: The Constitution as ratified in 1788 most clearly reflects the framers commitment to

choices.answer: the idea of direct democracy
the principle of limited government
the abolition of slavery
protecting the rights of the accused

questions.question: Which of the following most accurately describes The Federalist Papers?

choices.answer: the Federalist party platform during Adams' presidency
a popular anti-British booklet of the pre-Revolutionary era
collection of essays arguing the merits of the Constitution
the laws governing the colonies during Reconstruction

questions.question: A Supreme Court that demonstrates a willingness to change public policy is said to be engaging

choices.answer: in judicial activism
in due process
in judicial restraint
in ex post facto lawmaking

questions.question: A writ of certiorari from the Supreme Court indicates that the Court

choices.answer: will review a lower court decision
has rendered a decision on a case
has decided not to hear an appeal
plans to overturn a previous ruling

questions.question: American foreign policy is directed primarily by the

choices.answer: House of Representatives
United States Senate
President
Federal Bureaucracy

questions.question: In the Supreme Court decision of Brown v. Board of Education the Court issued the opinion that

choices.answer: accused persons must be informed of the charges against them
The Court decides the constitutionality of laws
separate educational facilities are inherently unequal
institutions may take steps to correct past wrongs

questions.question: The Congress is least likely to pass a bill the president has threatened to veto when

choices.answer: the president's public approval rating is extremely high
a failed attempt has been made to develop a compromise bill
the party controlling Congress is not the president's party
Congressional leaders have the votes to override a veto

questions.question: The House rules committee is considered among the most powerful because it has great power over

choices.answer: the ethical conduct of House members
the selection of federal judges
# of subcommittees that a standing committee may establish
scheduling of votes & conditions under which bills R amended

questions.question: Compared with political parties in Israel and England, American political parties are

choices.answer: less clearly identified with consistent political ideologies
less effective at raising money from political supporters
better able to reflect the goals of their constituencies
more likely to organize around a single issue or goal

questions.question: Which of the following people would most likely be accused of influence peddling?

choices.answer: A retired congressperson teaching government at university.
A former president who advises a current president.
A voter who researches the positions of all candidates.
A former State Department official who is a paid consultant.

questions.question: The primary function of political action committees (PACs) is to

choices.answer: contribute money to candidates for elections
coordinate local get-out-the-vote campaigns
promote the defeat of incumbents in federal legislatures
organize acts of civil disobedience

questions.question: Voters who rely exclusively on TV coverage of national elections are most likely to be  aware

choices.answer: of candidates' congressional voting records
of candidates' support as indicated by public opinion polls
of candidates' positions on international issues
of candidates' positions on domestic issues

questions.question: All of the following are specifically mentioned in the Constitution except

choices.answer: judicial review
the national census
rules of impeachment
length of term of federal judgeships

questions.question: The amount of access cabinet secretaries have to the president is most likely to be controlled

choices.answer: by the vice president
by the president's chief of staff
by the president's press secretary
by the national security advisor

questions.question: The line item veto was found unconstitutional because

choices.answer: it gave executive powers to the legislatures
it gave legislative powers to the bureaucracy
it gave legislative powers to the president
it gave  legislative power to the judiciary

questions.question: When the House and Senate pass different versions of the same bill,

choices.answer: the president signs the version he prefers.
each house's committee restarts the legislative process.
the two legislative bodies form a conference committee.
all amendments to the bill are invalidated.

questions.question: Which reason doesn't explain why the power & prestige of the presidency have grown since 1932?

choices.answer: America's prominence in international affairs has increased.
Improved public confidence in the federal government.
New programs have expanded federal responsibility.
Mass media coverage has increased presidential visibility.

questions.question: Unlike a treaty, an executive agreement

choices.answer: is not binding.
does not require the Senate's approval.
can be enforced by the military.
automatically expires after one year.

questions.question: The Supreme Court has original jurisdiction in all of the following types of cases except

choices.answer: if the U.S. is a party in the case.
cases involving criminal law between a citizen and a state.
if a case is between citizens from different states.
if cases arise under admiralty and maritime laws.

questions.question: Advocates of the idea that HR is the govt. institution most responsive to the public, cite

choices.answer: the high costs of congressional reelection campaigns.
Congressional oversight power over many executive agencies.
that representatives must run for reelection every 2 years.
calling citizens to testify b4 a Congressional committee.
